intro: Bonatea pauciflora, commonly known as the sparse-flowered bonatea, is a flowering plant native to the western regions of South Africa. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and prefers full sun exposure. Its small, yellow flowers are clustered in dense inflorescences, and it produces achenes as its seed type. Bonatea pauciflora is often found in fynbos vegetation, contributing to the biodiversity of its native habitat.
